description_text: The Product Manager ascertains what’s next for the product. This person serves as a member of the Product Team and works directly with the CEO. The Product Manager we’re looking for will work cross-functionally with engineering, growth, and marketing to bring unique value-based features to market across B2B2C. This role moves at a fast pace while maintaining excellent quality and a positive working attitude to strategize the Fabulous product roadmap.  Responsibilities  Outreach and Data Accumulation:   Connect with users: dig into user data, both qualitative and quantitative  Ascertains trends while being a champion for user-first experiences  Collaborate with researchers, data scientists, and business development teams to understand user needs and identify new product opportunities.  Immerse yourself in the psychology, pain points and behavior of users to develop strong intuition about solutions that will work for them.  Develop compelling roadmaps and metric targets that keep us on track towards our desired goals and continuously measure progress towards them.  Lead product ideation and prioritization within a key product area.   Evaluate ideas and lead product prioritization and releases  Have a consistent pipeline of fresh ideas that can help move the needle, through user research/feedback, driving brainstorms sessions, and doing competitive research  Ruthlessly prioritize these ideas in a robust, data-informed way, with an aim to have the most impact with limited resources – time, engineering resources, user volume, etc.  Leverage data to drive product development and experimentation.   Lead a cross-functional team through the product development cycle–UI/UX, engineering, QA, and data analysis.  Be the overall point-person to build compelling products and features for users.  Write design documents and web updates for new content/features/initiatives with input from curriculum, design & engineering partners.  Initiate data-driven experimentation and analysis on new products and features  Requirements   4+ years of relevant product management experience  Experience in a prior startup or other high-ambiguity environment  Prior consumer-facing product development experience, ideally with mobile or subscription-based products  Prior experience with psychology-based products, gamification, or other user behavior-oriented apps.  The Ideal Candidate is based in EUROPE.  Additional PM skills we highly value:   Consumer user empathy & perspective  Driving strategy & big-picture thinking  Experience with data analysis, metrics, and goal-setting  Analytical dexterity a.k.a. critical problem solving  Scrappy–execution & outcome-focused  Curious and teachable  Benefits   About Us An award-winning health, wellness, & coaching company that creates apps which fall the top ten internationally. Our science-based approach sits squarely in the tech-for-good lane, helping people live their best lives. Everyone who has joined this company is committed to using evidence-based research to find the absolute best ways to change lives for the better.   Our History Three co-founders created the Fabulous app: Sami, Amine, and Taylor. Growing up in Tunisia, Sami and Amine were only 16 when they met. With their early iteration, they reached out to Taylor, an award-winning designer in Malaysia. Their vision was welcomed into an incubation lab for startups at Duke University led by world-renowned Behavioral Economics Professor Dan Ariely. Our Chief Storyteller Jaz co-founded the Introductory Psychology program at Stanford University.  Our Approach We use a behavioral economics lens to help individuals find that 'on switch' inside them to achieve their fullest potential. What has emerged is a system that transforms tiny habits into profound long-term changes. A world in which people with ADHD thrive. A method for gratitude to reach through difficulty. A sanctuary to seek out your true purpose. A fountain of knowledge. A space for rest and self compassion.   Our Mission  Help every individual discover the wonderful person inside themselves by creating: beautiful, evidence-based, life-changing products.   Our Environment The first thing that sets us apart is that we’re not a place at all. While we’re a remote company, it’s not unusual to feel you know your teammates better than those you’ve shared an office with in the past. Ours is a professionally nourishing environment that is flexible and fully remote. Team members enjoy in house challenges and Slack event and work across a variety of tools. Meetings are kept to a minimum and deep work is encouraged.   Our Awards   Apple Best Apps of 2018  Editor’s app choice in more than 30 countries  Winner of Google’s Material Design Award  Best App Finalist in Google Play Awards  Consistently ranking in the top ten Health & Fitness apps across platforms  Backed by Facebook Startup Lab and Microsoft Venture   Our Norms  Ownership: Be the CEO of your tasks. No one is watching over your shoulder. Be the proof. Open Communication: Constructive ideas are always flying across time zones. Deep Work: Disconnect. Find your flow. Become industrious. It’s about the work here. Always Offer Context: Sharing rationale works wonders in asynchronous conversations. Impeccable Agreement: Promise, then follow through. Everyone relies on everyone. Egos are checked at the door. Those who join our workforce place themselves in service of our members.  Our Values #collaboration #craftsmanship #feedback #respect #responsibility #simplicity #speed   Our Future To this day, over 30 million people have started their journey to better themselves with our apps. We are creating a generation of change-makers, with the same drive to help others, each in their own way.  Our Invitation At Fabulous, every team member is a sculptor in their own right. Together, we help millions of users step out of their block of stone and step into the fullest version of their life through behavioral science. Tell us what drives you; if you were to pick up your tools, what would you contribution look like?

description_text: Unleash Your Potential at L'Oréal's Beauty Tech!  For more than a century, L'Oréal has devoted itself solely to one business: Beauty. Present in 150 countries across five continents and with EUR42 billion consolidated sales, L'Oréal is the global industry leader. With 37 global beauty brands across four divisions, L'Oréal offers beauty for each covering all beauty categories and catering to all beauty desires. With the acquisition of the Australian brand Asop in 2023, the Group continues to expand its portfolio through targeted acquisitions as part of its drive to create the future of beauty.  Today, L'Oréal includes more than 2,000 tech positions and is constantly growing. Beauty Tech is changing the game and leading the shift towards new consumer realities and a digital disruption. Championing Beauty Tech, we invent the beauty of the future while becoming the company of the future.  Beauty Tech is how we know our consumers intimately, augmenting their beauty journeys with unparalleled diverse and sustainable experiences. Beauty Tech equips the Group with the key assets it needs to conquer this new world, where Tech has become strategic. With this ambition, L'Oréal continues to recruit diverse, innovative, skilled and passionate minds in different tech domains such as Data, Digital, Cloud, Cyber Security, IT Architecture, DevOps, Applications and Infrastructure.  YOUR FUTURE TEAM  L'Oréal is in a period of fast growth in digital transformation. To accelerate our ambition to be the global leader in Beauty Tech, we launched Tech Accelerator, a multidisciplinary venture studio composed of top talents from all types of backgrounds.  With 4 hubs in Paris, New York, Shanghai and Singapore, our Tech Accelerator teams blend rare resources & state-of-the-art technologies to deliver strategic deep tech projects at scale for L'Oréal Groupe's long-term business ambition.  What you'll do  Take total ownership.  Create impactful product vision, build product strategy, and prioritize on what matters:  Lead and synthesize key research from user & market research, tech opportunities and constraints, to data & data science availability and feasibility Build consensus across the organization on vision and strategy and ensure cross-team alignment Active stakeholder management and key business leaders on vision and strategy. Form pragmatic strategies balancing enterprise priorities, user pain points, market insights, organization constraints, and business/tech constraints. Go beyond pretty presentations.  Champion successful product delivery, product launch, and scale with ambitious and robust growth strategy  Lead the Product Team and give visibility on the roadmap and delivery to stakeholders Lead the synthesis of user feedback post-launch to prioritize new problems and opportunities Define product North Star KPIs, and make appropriate decisions for continuous improvement Enrich the product knowledge base (roadmap, product vision, strategy, KPIs board, artefacts...) with continuous enrichment and improvement. Drive tangible business results.  Lead high-value initiatives to ensure the product's future success in the business context.  Support the definition of budget, business value KPIs and ROI, so to prove the product's value Coordinate teams and Senior Stakeholders to ensure smooth and efficient collaboration, develop strong relationships and influence with key Executives and Senior Stakeholders Manage external partners from evaluation, performance management along with budget planning and follow up Evangelize Beauty Tech: identify new partners, advocate for the data, tech and product management practices at L'Oréal and outside (meetups, webinars, academic partners...), support the change and transformation of the company through products THIS IS WHAT YOU WILL NEED TO SUCCEED!  We love people that are curious, collaborative, and entrepreneurial. Those who are constantly thinking outside-the-box and challenging the status quo, please step forward!  As a Senior Product Manager, it will be important for you to have strong experience in:  6 Years or more experience working as a Product Manager Product Management know-how in transforming user pain points into practical solutions. Big-picture thinking while being detailed in managing a high-energy and dynamic development team Demonstrate a passion for customer centric products and services, with an intuition on 'why it works' Strong business & operations acumen to effectively co-problem solve with the business leaders Clearly demonstrate delivery success by being results-oriented, data-driven, pragmatic & self-efficient. Have balanced interpersonal and analytical skills, combined with intellectual curiosity and a will to 'get things done'. It is also important for you to show great curiosity in understanding the non-mastered technologies such as  Innovation Curiosity Communication skills (i.e.: stakeholders, internal client) Strategy Entrepreneurship LET US GIVE YOU 6 OTHER REASONS TO JOIN US!  Joining L'Oréal means joining a company that: Invests in Tech and positions its Tech teams at the heart of its digital transformation strategy. Allows its employees to have a real impact, to test their ideas, to innovate and to build our future. Offers a Hybrid Work Policy: 3 Days in Office, 2 Days Work from Home Provides many benefits: VIP staff shop offering our products at a preferential rate, a company restaurant & gym, 60% reimbursement of transportation subscription, a work council offering lots of employee discounts (social & cultural activities, holiday vouchers etc.) and much more! Delivers a powerful and innovative HR policy: dynamic mobility policy, significant investment in employee training, regular re-evaluation of remuneration, numerous innovative HR measures: Time Savings Account, paternity leave, Citizen Day, etc. Is an Equal Opportunity Employer and takes pride in a diverse environment. We would love to find out more about you as a candidate and we do not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion, or other employment practices. The beauty we find in our differences gives us the freedom to go beyond. That's the beauty of L'Oréal.

  • Knowledge of modern product practices (discovery, design thinking, delivery, etc.).

  • Strong curiosity and eagerness to learn about payment systems and e-commerce.

Recueillir et formaliser les besoins utilisateurs et/ou du commanditaire.  Organiser des ateliers de conception pour la rédaction des User Stories avec les parties prenantes métier.  Créer et gérer la roadmap produit, définissant les fonctionnalités prioritaires pour aligner les objectifs commerciaux et techniques.  Réaliser des études d’impact fonctionnel et métier des nouvelles solutions à mettre en œuvre.  Participer activement aux différents rituels SCRUM tels que les sprint planning, les daily stand-ups, les sprint reviews et les sprint rétrospectives.  Collaborer avec les équipes de design UX/UI pour développer des interfaces répondant aux attentes des utilisateurs.  Assurer la coordination entre les équipes de développement, de design, de marketing et de vente pour le développement et la promotion du produit.  Suivre et garantir la qualité des User Stories livrées, en surveillant les performances et le bon fonctionnement.  Contrôler et valider la qualité en s'assurant que le produit et les fonctionnalités développées correspondent aux besoins métier, en étroite collaboration avec les référents et experts métier ainsi que d'autres utilisateurs.  Communiquer avec toutes les parties prenantes pour aligner les attentes et diriger le produit dans la bonne direction. Qualification téléphonique  Entretien Manager  Entretien RH et Direction (si nécessaire).

REJOIGNEZ LE PREMIER RÉSEAU D’ACCOMPAGNEMENT DES ENTREPRISES

Attaché aux valeurs de l’entreprise, au progrès économique et à la proximité, le réseau des Chambres de Commerce et d’Industrie est le 1er réseau public à l’entreprise en France, reposant sur l’engagement de 9 000 élus bénévoles et près de 14 000 collaborateurs !

Chaque année, grâce au réseau des CCI :

  • Une entreprise est accompagnée toutes les 5 secondes, pour un projet de création / transmission / développement
  • 450 000 jeunes et adultes sont formés, nous positionnant comme le premier formateur (initiale et continue) en France après l’Etat.
  • 500 infrastructures sont gérées au quotidien : ports, aéroports, lieux d’hébergement des entreprises, centres des congrès et parcs d’exposition, etc.

CCI France est la tête de réseau des CCI :

  • Elle élabore la stratégie nationale du réseau des chambres de commerce et d'industrie
  • Elle pilote des projets d’ampleur nationale au bénéfice du réseau
  • Elle anime les communautés métier : appui aux entreprises, compétences, développement des territoires, etc.
  • Elle définit et suit la mise en oeuvre de la politique générale du réseau en matière de gestion des personnels des chambres

VOUS INTEGREZ UNE DIRECTION DYNAMIQUE

Au sein de la Direction des opérations, le pôle « Entreprises & territoires »

  • nourrit la stratégie du réseau des CCI sur les thèmes de l’appui aux entreprises et aux territoires : création, transmission – reprise, financement formalités, numérique et IA, transition écologique, RH, industrie, économie de proximité, aménagement durable des territoires…
  • construit avec le réseau et déploie les opérations nationales contractualisées avec l’Etat au bénéfice des TPE – PME
  • pilote les projets nationaux issus du plan stratégique
  • anime les communautés métier réseau, en favorisant l’échange des meilleures pratiques entre les 122 CCI du réseau
  • noue et anime des partenariats avec les acteurs nationaux de l’appui aux entreprises et aux territoires

VOS MISSIONS SONT VARIÉES ET STRUCTURANTES

Digipilote est l’outil de référence des 3 000 conseillers entreprises du réseau des CCI. Il permet la réalisation de diagnostics simplifiés ou approfondis de TPE – PME sur des thèmes aussi variés que leur transition écologique, leur maturité numérique ou encore leur performance RH. L’outil est entièrement adaptable et paramétrable à partir des référentiels métier qui y sont intégrés.

Sous l’autorité hiérarchique du Directeur du pôle Entreprises et Territoires, et en lien permanent avec la DSI de CCI France et les utilisateurs du réseau :

Vous coordonnez la maitrise d’ouvrage de l’outil Digipilote, outil de référence des métiers de l’appui aux entreprises :

  • définition avec les utilisateurs (CCI France, communautés de l’appui aux entreprises) d’une vision claire et précise du produit Digipilote et de sa contribution aux objectifs stratégiques du réseau des CCI
  • animation des clubs utilisateurs et comités de gouvernance
  • identification des nouveaux référentiels à mettre en œuvre
  • mise en œuvre de ces nouveaux référentiels
  • documentation et harmonisation des processus métier
  • synthèse des demandes d’évolutions des référentiels métiers intégrés dans l’outil

Vous contribuez à formuler la feuille de route fonctionnelle de Digipilote :

  • création, animation et mise à jour du backlog produit
  • formalisation d’une feuille de route en lien avec les équipes de la DSI de CCI France
  • synthèse et documentation des besoins d’évolutions fonctionnelles remontées par les utilisateurs du réseau
  • priorisation des besoins au regard des enjeux du réseau et des ressources allouées
  • rédaction de user stories à destination des équipes de développement
  • test et validation des nouvelles fonctionnalités

Votre assurez un support utilisateur auprès des conseillers entreprises du réseau :

  • documentation des demandes ou incidents dans un système de gestion de tickets
  • gestion des droits d’accès et permission des utilisateurs
  • formation des utilisateurs, en particulier les nouveaux arrivants
  • documentation et mise à jour des guides utilisateur et modes opératoires

Vous pilotez les métriques d’activité et de performance de l’outil Digipilote :

  • définition des métriques et KPI’s
  • remontée et consolidation des données
  • synthèse et communication du reporting aux instances de CCI France

Cette description présente les principales responsabilités du poste ; elle n’est pas limitative.

PROFIL RECHERCHÉ : ENGAGEMENT, EXPERTISE ET ANIMATION

Nous recherchons une personne capable de porter une vision stratégique du produit Digipilote, de construire et piloter une roadmap fonctionnelle et de fédérer une communauté d’utilisateurs.

Diplôme et expérience

  • Formation supérieure en informatique, gestion de projet, ou dans un domaine connexe
  • 5 ans d'expérience minimum en gestion de produit
  • Une expérience préalable dans un rôle similaire au sein d'un réseau ou d'une structure publique serait un atout

Compétences Techniques

  • Compréhension technique de l’outil : Capacité à comprendre les aspects techniques du produit, et à les partager auprès d’un public non expert
  • Gestion et mise à jour d’un backlog: priorisation et maintien du backlog produit en fonction des besoins utilisateurs et des évolutions de la stratégie
  • Rédaction de spécifications fonctionnelles : analyse des besoins et rédaction de user stories claires et détaillées
  • Compétences en gestion de projet, y compris l'utilisation d'outils de gestion de projet et de méthodologies agiles
  • Maitrise de la gouvernance IT

Aptitudes Professionnelles

  • Intérêt pour les métiers des CCI, en particulier l’appui aux entreprises
  • Capacité à formuler une vision « produit » et analyser un marché
  • Capacité à travailler en équipe et à animer des communautés utilisateurs
  • Excellentes compétences en communication et en animation de réunions
  • Capacité à influencer et à mobiliser les parties prenantes à différents niveaux
  • Sens de l'organisation et gestion des priorités
  • Posture servicielle
  • Capacités rédactionnelles et de formalisation de présentations

Poste accessible aux personnes en situation de handicap.

Type d'emploi : Temps plein, CDI
Statut : Cadre

Avantages :

  • Flextime
  • Prise en charge du transport quotidien
  • Restaurant d'entreprise
  • RTT
  • Travail à domicile occasionnel

Lieu du poste : Télétravail hybride (92300 Levallois-Perret)

Owkin K, our AI co-pilot combines unparalleled access to multimodal data, cutting-edge AI to understand biology and pioneering agentic AI to achieve Biological Artificial Superintelligence in the future. Owkin has raised over $300 million through investments from leading biopharma companies, including Sanofi and BMS, and venture funds like Fidelity, GV and Bpifrance, among others.Owkin is seeking the best and brightest to join our fast-growing and dynamic team.              Position is based in our Paris, Nantes or London offices or remotely in France, UK, Germany.     Please submit your CV in English     About the role:    We're building AI agents that help researchers solve real problems in biology and drug discovery. description_text: About Keyrock Since our beginnings in 2017, we've grown to be a leading change-maker in the digital asset space, renowned for our partnerships and innovation.  Today, we partner with over 180 team members around the world. Our diverse team hails from 42 nationalities, with backgrounds ranging from self-taught DeFi natives to PhDs. Predominantly remote, we have hubs in London, Brussels, and Singapore, and host regular online and offline hangouts to keep the crew tight.  We are trading on more than 80 exchanges, and working with a wide array of asset issuers. As a well-established market maker, our distinctive expertise led us to expand rapidly. Today, our services span market making, options trading, high-frequency trading, OTC, and DeFi trading desks.  But we’re more than a service provider. We’re an initiator. We're pioneers in adopting the Rust Development language for our algorithmic trading, and champions of its use in the industry. We support the growth of Web3 startups through our Accelerator Program. We upgrade ecosystems by injecting liquidity into promising DeFi, RWA, and NFT protocols. And we push the industry's progress with our research and governance initiatives.  At Keyrock, we're not just envisioning the future of digital assets. We're actively building it.   Mission statement We are seeking a highly technical, hands-on Technical Product Manager to join our team and act as the internal, central hub for core services and automation that support trading business units at Keyrock. This is a role for a builder at heart—someone who can not only identify opportunities but also rapidly prototype solutions. You will be pivotal in assessing technical solutions (buy vs build), connecting APIs, building proofs of concept, and driving the integration of cutting-edge technology to solve critical business challenges. Working in close coordination with the VP of Product, and in support of the COO office and VP of Engineering, you will bridge the gap between idea and implementation with a focus on the non-trading teams of Keyrock. Your primary responsibility is to assess outcomes and value (prioritisation) and translate complex needs into tangible, working prototypes, demonstrating value and technical feasibility firsthand, in alignment with the VP Engineering and software development practices at Keyrock. A strong background in software development is therefore essential for this role. You will support critical visibility and communication at the centre of Keyrock, paving the way for our engineering teams to build and scale the proven solutions you have discovered and proven.  Keyrock Product Managers are responsible for developing valuable and viable systems (& implicit services) that consider the voices of   Business & Commercial teams,  Trading & Research teams,  And Engineering builders.   In this way, a level of ‘trilingual’ competency is required for the role.   Outcomes    Strategy, Roadmap, & Technical alignment: You will turn the goals of central technology teams into a clear roadmap. You'll run regular meetings with these teams, together with leaders from product, engineering, and architecture to find problems early, understand how projects depend on each other, and spot chances to improve how we work together.   Technology Assessment & Prioritisation: You will help us make smart technology choices. You'll figure out what our teams need, decide whether it's better to build our own solution or buy one, and use clear data to balance what's valuable for the business against how hard it is to build.   Technical Solution discovery, design & prototyping: You will quickly build working models to test out new ideas. You'll be hands-on, creating functional prototypes to see if a concept is worth pursuing before we invest heavily in it.   Stakeholder Communication & Central Operations: You will be the initial product & tech contact for our business operations and back-office teams. You'll explain our technology plans in simple terms to everyone, ensuring we're all on the same page, and help our central Platform team explore new product ideas.   Engineering Collaboration & Systems Integration: When needed, you will design and build the first versions of new solutions to see how they fit into our existing systems, following guidance from our senior engineering and product leaders. You'll set a clear example for how to move from a defined idea to a developed, performant, secure, product, for other teams to follow.   Technical Research & Experimentation: You will actively test new and emerging technologies to see if they're actually useful for us. When our tech leaders have an idea, you'll go beyond basic research by getting your hands dirty, setting up new tools, and finding out their real-world value for Keyrock.   Reporting Performance & Impact Measurement: You will measure the success of our new ideas and products. You'll create simple metrics to track their impact, use data and feedback to make improvements, and work with our data visualization team to present the results clearly, helping us manage risks before they become problems.   Process Optimisation & FinOps: You will find ways to make our operations run more smoothly and cost-effectively. You'll review our current processes to see where we can improve and help the company adopt best practices for managing and reducing our cloud spending.    Essentials    Proven Development Background: 5+ years of experience in a tech operations, software development, or data engineering role is required. You must have a strong portfolio and be comfortable writing code, building data pipelines, and integrating systems.   Technical Product Management Experience: A demonstrated track record of transitioning from a purely technical role to one with product ownership responsibilities, successfully launching and iterating on technical products.   Pragmatic Builder's Mindset: An ability to translate complex problems into simple, functional prototypes. You are driven to build first and prove value through working software.   Financial Domain Exposure: Prior exposure to financial contexts, market data, and time series data manipulation is highly desirable. Experience in fintech, trading, or quantitative finance is a significant plus.   Excellent Communicator: Ability to articulate complex technical concepts to diverse audiences and act as a credible, influential voice at the intersection of business, trading, and engineering.   Ownership & Autonomy: A self-starter with an entrepreneurial spirit, capable of managing projects from ideation to initial implementation with a high degree of autonomy.    Beneficial experience    Infrastructure Experience: Hands-on experience with cloud infrastructure (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure), containerization (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes), and CI/CD pipelines is a significant bonus.  3+ years of experience working directly in a financial services context (e.g., proprietary trading, asset management, market making).  A strong grasp of the technologies underpinning recent AI developments (e.g., transformer architectures, retrieval-augmented generation and MCP).    Our recruitment philosophy We value self-awareness in our recruitment process. We seek people who understand themselves and their career goals. We're after those with the right skills and a conscious choice to join our field. The perfect fit? A crypto enthusiast who’s driven, collaborative, and delivers solid, scalable outcomes.   Why Keyrock?   Be at the forefront of innovation in digital assets.  Work on challenging problems with a direct impact on the business.  A competitive salary package, with various benefits depending on the method of engagement (employee or freelancer).  Autonomy in your time management thanks to flexible working hours and the opportunity to work remotely  The freedom to create your own entrepreneurial experience by being part of a team of people in search of excellence   As an employer we are committed to build an inclusive, diverse and non-discriminating work environment. We welcome employees of all backgrounds, ethnicities, genders, creed and sexual orientation. We hire, reward and promote entirely based on merit and performance.  Due to the nature of our business and external requirements, we perform background checks on all potential employees, passing which is a prerequisite to join Keyrock.

Un environnement de travail et une culture d’entreprise permettant à tous les profils de s’épanouir au quotidien.

    As part of Match Group, we manage a diverse portfolio of brands, from iconic names like Meetic, Match, Lexa, and LoveScout to tailored experiences for singles over 50, OurTime, DisonsDemain, Zweizam, and single parents, Even and Stir.
      Our teams design, build, and scale platforms across 20+ countries and 18 languages, ensuring every single finds the right match for their lifestyle and lifestages. We also drive growth for other Match Group brands like The League, OkCupid, Archer, Salams, and Plenty Of Fish, expanding our impact worldwide.
      When it comes to dating, the connection starts online, but the real magic happens once you meet in real life (IRL). We think the same is true for creating the best platforms, so we work together IRL 3 days / week in our office, 53 rue de Chateaudun, 75009 Paris.
      The position : We are looking for an Online Advertising Marketing Manager to join the Meetic team. You will be responsible for developing and executing innovative performance marketing strategies that drive awareness, engagement, customer acquisition, and revenue growth.

    Creation, implementation, analysis and optimization of advertising campaigns with a direct response focus on Social Media, SEM, Affiliation, ASO.
    Outperform monthly goals.
    Collect and analyze campaign data, synthesize results and identify actionable opportunities and best practices to improve campaign performances.
    Manage relationships with online marketing partners.
    Report performance daily and monthly.
    Collaborate with the design team to develop creative test strategies and provide strategic context and insight for creative idea generation.

description_text: Chez Withings, nous souhaitons redonner aux individus le contrôle de leur santé. Nous avons l’obsession de créer des produits beaux et intuitifs, afin que chacun puisse les utiliser facilement au quotidien; nos balances connectées, montres hybrides, tensiomètres, moniteurs de sommeil et tous les dispositifs de notre gamme sont aujourd’hui utilisés par des millions d’utilisateurs. Notre objectif : permettre la prévention, le dépistage et l’accompagnement d’un certain nombre de maladies chroniques via des produits et des services innovants, afin de révolutionner la manière dont on prend soin de notre santé. Le PM est le garant du bon déroulement du développement du produit. Il intervient très en amont pendant les phases d'analyse et de définition du besoin et des fonctionnalités, puis durant tout le cycle de vie du produit. Il doit notamment suivre le développement technique du produit, les aspects réglementaires, et s'assurer de la mise sur le marché du produit dans les temps. Il travaille en étroite collaboration avec les différentes équipes pour mener à bien le projet. En tant que stagiaire PM, tu seras amené.e à:   Prendre en main des sujets techniques (hardware, logiciel et application) en collaboration avec les équipes de développement au sein de Withings ;  Intervenir sur l’assemblage, les tests et la validation des prototypes ;  T’approprier l’expérience utilisateur Withings et réfléchir à son amélioration ;  Développer la cohérence de la gamme des balances Withings ;  Définir les spécifications de nouvelles fonctionnalités et participer à leur développement ;  Participer à la rédaction de la documentation et des contenus réglementaires ;  Créer et améliorer des contenus en lien avec l'expérience utilisateur ;  Bêta-tester des produits et services.  Requirements   Tu es issu.e d’une formation école d’ingénieurs et tu es idéalement à la recherche d’un stage de fin d’études ou de césure ;  Tu as une forte appétence pour le développement de produits complexes et innovants ;  Tu as un vif intérêt pour les sujets liés à la santé connectée ;  Tu sais mettre l’utilisateur au centre de tes réflexions ;  Tu es rigoureux.se, polyvalent.e et autonome ;  Tu es passionné.e par la tech et les produits connectés.  Benefits Rejoindre l’aventure Withings, c’est :   Intégrer un des pionniers et leaders mondiaux de la santé connectée, plusieurs fois primé au Consumer Electronic Show  Contribuer à des projets innovants et ambitieux pour la santé de demain dans un environnement agile et en constante évolution  Intégrer une entreprise internationale, membre de la FrenchTech 120, dont les équipes sont basées à Issy-les-Moulineaux, Boston, Hong-Kong et Shenzhen  Participer à l’amélioration continue de nos produits et services en les bêta-testant avant leur sortie, notamment lors de nos nombreuses sessions sportives entre collègues  Participer à la Withings Med Academy en assistant à des conférences de professionnels de santé afin de renforcer ses connaissances dans le domaine médical  Collaborer avec des collègues passionnés et célébrer ensemble chacune de nos réussites !  Toutes les candidatures reçues sont étudiées indépendamment de l’origine ethnique, des croyances, de la religion, du genre, de l’orientation sexuelle ou de la santé des candidats. Withings aspire à offrir et garantir l’égalité des chances aux candidats et seules les personnes habilitées (RH et Management) auront accès aux informations concernant votre candidature.

description_text:
Hi there! Thanks for stopping by The Product Marketing team at Lightspeed is seeking a creative, results-oriented Product Marketing Manager, Hospitality to accelerate growth of the Lightspeed Restaurant product in EMEA (Germany focused). Reporting to the Senior Manager, Hospitality PMM and working closely with other Hospitality PMMs based in EMEA and APAC, you will: develop, coordinate, and execute product launches and go-to-market programs for the Hospitality product portfolio; establish impactful positioning and messaging; conduct market analysis; gather customer feedback; and act as the voice of the customer within the organization and ensure customer needs are addressed at each marketing touchpoint. At Lightspeed, as Product Marketing Manager, you will build relationships throughout the organization. You will interact with diverse stakeholders such as product, marketing, sales, customer service, partnerships and others in order to help shape product roadmap and accelerate the launch and lifecycle management of your product portfolio.   What you'll be responsible for:   Own product positioning and messaging for your portfolio, ensuring clarity, differentiation, and alignment across all customer touchpoints.  Deeply understand the Hospitality industry, including market dynamics, customer needs, and the technology landscape that empowers restaurateurs to succeed.  Lead competitive and market analysis, including win/loss research and industry trend monitoring, using insights to shape product strategy, messaging, and go-to-market (GTM) execution.  Conduct ongoing customer research, including interviews and surveys, to build and maintain a deep understanding of customer personas, needs, and behaviors.  Drive go-to-market strategy and execution for new and existing products in your portfolio, collaborating cross-functionally and owning the performance of GTM initiatives.  Develop roadmaps of marketing initiatives that span the customer lifecycle, from initial launch through product adoption, onboarding and retention.  Track KPIs that will help drive the overall success of your product portfolio.    Being the go-to person for messaging around your product portfolio and value proposition  Develop collaborative relationships with various cross-functional teams, including Marketing, Product Managers, GTM leadership, and production teams of creatives and automation specialists.  Act as the key liaison for go-to-market teams in your region. Leverage insights from internal stakeholders and customers to optimize funnel and enhance enablement material.    Collaborate with Creative, Content, and Product teams to develop compelling, customer-centric content and campaigns that drive impact.    What you need to bring to the team:   3-5 years experience working in product marketing, growth or lifecycle marketing, or similar go-to-market experience.  Previous background in SaaS marketing, or with exposure to small business audiences.  Experience in positioning, messaging, and driving product growth.  Proven ability to collaborate across teams.  Experience in generating market insights and competitor intelligence.  Excellent project management and communication skills with cross-functional and cross-regional stakeholders to meet project objectives and deadlines.  Genuine interest in and curiosity in helping small businesses succeed.  Bilingual proficiency in English and German.    Even better if you have, but not necessary:   Experience in the hospitality industry in any capacity is a strong asset!  Enthusiasm for innovative technologies (e.g., AI) and their application to real-world product experiences is a plus  MBA or Product Marketing Alliance certification    What's in it for you? Come live the Lightspeed experience...   Ability to do your job in a truly flexible environment;  Genuine career opportunities in a company that's creating new jobs every day;  Work in a team big enough for growth but lean enough to make a real impact.  … and enjoy a range of benefits that'll keep you happy, healthy, and (not) hungry:   Lightspeed RSU program (we are all owners)  Unlimited paid time off policy  Flexible working policy  Immediate access to health insurance  Health and wellness benefits  Paid leave assistance for new parents  Linkedin learning license  1 paid volunteer day annually     To all recruitment agencies: Lightspeed does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. If we have not directly engaged your company in writing to supply candidates for a specific vacancy, Lightspeed will not be responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.   Lightspeed is a proud equal opportunity employer and we are committed to creating an inclusive and barrier-free workplace. Lightspeed welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.   Where to from here? Obviously, this has to be mutually beneficial: we want you to step into a role you love, and we want to offer you a place you're proud to come to every day. For a glimpse into our world check out our career page here.  Lightspeed is building communities through commerce, and we need people from all backgrounds and lived experiences to do that. We were founded in 2005, in Montreal's gay village and our original members were all part of the LGBTQ+ community. The ethos of our business has been about inclusion from the very beginning, and we strive to provide a workplace where everyone belongs.   Who we are:  Powering the businesses that are the backbone of the global economy, Lightspeed's one-stop commerce platform helps merchants innovate to simplify, scale, and provide exceptional customer experiences. Our cloud commerce solution transforms and unifies online and physical operations, multichannel sales, expansion to new locations, global payments, financial solutions, and connection to supplier networks.     Founded in Montréal, Canada in 2005, Lightspeed is dual-listed on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE: LSPD) and Toronto Stock Exchange (TSX: LSPD). With teams across North America, Europe, and Asia Pacific, the company serves retail, hospitality, and golf businesses in over 100 countries.
           Lightspeed handles your information in accordance with our Applicant Privacy Statement.

Your passion lies in crafting compelling narratives, orchestrating high-impact product and feature launches, and architecting go-to-market strategies that leave the competition in the dust. Brand Amplification: Infuse our brand and thought leadership with compelling insights derived directly from our product's capabilities and customer successes. Deep understanding of SaaS products, data, analytics, decision support, and/or professional service models.    Ability to have credible technical conversations with engineering teams to fully understand product capabilities and roadmap.    Skilled at articulating technical product differences and translating them into clear, compelling value propositions for marketing and sales.    Experience collaborating closely with Sales Engineering to ensure technical accuracy and impact in go-to-market messaging.    Demonstrable expertise in developing and executing high-impact go-to-market strategies for B2B tech products.    A passion for shaping and defining new software categories, with experience in taking innovative products to market.    A history of delivering measurable results and managing complex, multi-product GTM programmes.    The drive to thrive autonomously and excel in a complex, technical industry. A proven ability to 'bring products to life' with energy and impact in a fast-moving market.    Meticulous attention to detail and commitment to delivering world-class product experiences and marketing materials.    Outstanding organisational and project management skills with the ability to manage multiple priorities effectively.    Superior communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills that command attention.    Nice to Have    Deep experience marketing AI-native platforms.
